title: Hindustan Copper consolidated net profit rises 18% to Rs 134.28 crore in Q1
summary: Hindustan Copper Limited (HCL) has reported an 18% y-o-y rise in consolidated net profit to Rs 134.28 crore for the first quarter of the current financial year. Consolidated total income rose 5% to Rs 526.65 crore.
fullContent: Hindustan Copper Limited (HCL) has reported an 18% y-o-y rise in consolidated net profit to Rs 134.28 crore for the first quarter of the current financial year. Consolidated total income rose 5% to Rs 526.65 crore. The higher profit is on account of expenses remaining flat at Rs 347.29 crore.

title: Russia Is Losing the South Caucasus
summary: The recent peace agreement between Armenia and Azerbaijan suggests that Russian President Vladimir Putin’s desire to dominate the South Caucasus may be producing the opposite effect: a total loss of control.
fullContent: The recent peace agreement between Armenia and Azerbaijan suggests that Russian President Vladimir Putin’s desire to dominate the South Caucasus may be producing the opposite effect: a total loss of control. title: How Canada’s Oil Sands Producers Pump More Crude from the Same Assets
summary: Canada’s major oil sands producers are boosting crude production even if they aren’t starting up new projects. The secret sauce appears to be reducing maintenance times and extending maintenance cycles to squeeze more oil and raise efficiencies, Bloomberg reports.
fullContent: Canada’s major oil sands producers are boosting crude production even if they aren’t starting up new projects. The secret sauce appears to be reducing maintenance times and extending maintenance cycles to squeeze more oil and raise efficiencies, Bloomberg reports. Suncor Energy, for example, completed ahead of schedule a multi-year effort to replace eight coke drums at its Base Plant, extending the life of the facility’s Upgrader 1 by about 30 years. “Everything went flawlessly, resulting in the project being completed safely,…
